topic.title: Conditional processing
topic.shortdesc: The DITA standard includes elements and attributes that support conditional processing. These elements and attributes provide the general semantics for managing conditional processing, but they impose neither requirements nor restrictions on how particular processors format the output.

body.p: This topic was removed from the "Introduction to DITA" section. We need to ensure that all relevant content in this topic is covered in the applicable section.The DITA standard includes a starter set of attributes that can be used to perform conditional processing. Additional attributes also can be specialized from the @props attribute. When conditional processing attributes are applied to elements in a topic or DITA map, such elements can be filtered (included or excluded) or flagged (marked with highlighting or images) when processed. This facility enables authors and information architects to create topics and DITA maps that contain elements that apply to specific sets of conditions; the conditions can represent any set of distinctions that are meaningful to the information set, such as product version, audience type, software and hardware platform, and more.

When DITA content is processed, the set of applicable conditions for the processing session is defined and elements are included, excluded, and flagged based on how they match those conditions that are defined. The DITAVAL file is one mechanism for specifying how processors should handle the conditional processing attributes. Processors may provide other mechanisms for conditional processing.
